com.google.android.glass.TMM

Class VideoCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.glass.TMM.TMMCard
      • com.google.android.glass.TMM.VideoCard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TMMCard>

    public class VideoCard
extends TMMCard
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Class VideoCard. This card contains information representing a single card in the TellMeMore app. This card is used to present context-relevant video information to the user, usually related to what they are learning about at that time.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    atm011
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoCard

        public VideoCard(int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new video card, with no source video or screenshot.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • VideoCard

        public VideoCard(int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 java.lang.String ytId,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new video card, with a specific video ID tag but no screenshot.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        ytId - The youtube ID tag of the video to play. Found at the end of the video URL.
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • VideoCard

        public VideoCard(java.lang.String id,
                 int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 java.lang.String ss_path,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new video card.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        ss_path - The path to the screenshot image for this video card.
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • VideoCard

        public VideoCard(java.lang.String id,
                 int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 java.lang.String ss_path,
                 int playcount,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new video card.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        ss_path - The path to the screenshot image for this video card.
        playcount - The playcount of the video, obtained either via the API or an application-specific counter
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • VideoCard

        public VideoCard(java.lang.String id,
                 int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 java.lang.String ss_path,
                 java.lang.String youTubeTag,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new video card.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        ss_path - The path to the screenshot image for this video card.
        youTubeTag - The youtube ID tag of the video to play. Found at the end of the video URL.
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • VideoCard

        public VideoCard(java.lang.String id,
                 int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 java.lang.String ss_path,
                 int playcount,
                 java.lang.String youTubeTag,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new video card.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        ss_path - The path to the screenshot image for this video card.
        playcount - The playcount of the video, obtained either via the API or an application-specific counter
        youTubeTag - The youtube ID tag of the video to play. Found at the end of the video URL.
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • VideoCard

        public VideoCard(java.lang.String id,
                 int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 int playcount,
                 java.lang.String youTubeTag,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new video card.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        playcount - The playcount of the video, obtained either via the API or an application-specific counter
        youTubeTag - The youtube ID tag of the video to play. Found at the end of the video URL.
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • setScreenshot

        public void setScreenshot(java.lang.String screenshotPath)
        Sets the path of the screenshot image for the card.
        Parameters:
        screenshotPath - The path of the new screenshot image to set.

      • getPlayCount

        public int getPlayCount()
        Gets the play count of the video contained in the card.
        Returns:
        The number of times the video on this card has been played.

      • setPlayCount

        public void setPlayCount(int playCount)
        Sets the play count of the video contained in the card.
        Parameters:
        playCount - The number to set the new play counter to.

      • getYTtag

        public java.lang.String getYTtag()
        Gets the youtube ID tag of the video to play.
        Returns:
        The youtube ID tag of the video to play.

      • setYTtag

        public void setYTtag(java.lang.String yTtag)
        Sets the youtube ID tag of the video contained in the card.
        Parameters:
        yTtag - The new Youtube tag to set for the VideoCard.

      • hasScreenshot

        public boolean hasScreenshot()
        Checks for the existence of a screenshot contained within this card.
        Returns:
        true, if there is a screenshot for the video contained in the card.

      • getScrenshotname

        public java.lang.String getScrenshotname()
        Gets the filename of the screenshot image.
        Returns:
        The name of the screenshot image file.

      • setScrenshotname

        private void setScrenshotname(java.lang.String screnshotname)
        Sets the filename of the screenshot image. Users should not access this method directly to maintain consistency between the pathname and the filename.
        Parameters:
        screnshotname - The new name of the screenshot image file.
